item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 20 LIVE Updates: Parliament row escalates as BJP, Congress trade charges over ‘scuffle’ at Makar Dwar - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rajya Sabha Rejects No-Confidence Motion Against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar

Date: December 21, 2024 • Source: Indian Express

The 20th day of the Winter Session saw the Rajya Sabha deputy chairman dismissing the impeachment notice against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar. Allegations of bias were made by around 60 opposition members who signed the notice.

  • Opposition members claimed not to have trust in Dhankhar, labeling him as biased.
  • A scuffle occurred on Parliament premises between members of the INDIA and BJP alliances.
  • BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi accused Rahul Gandhi of pushing an MP that led to injuries.
  • A Joint Parliamentary Committee was announced to review the ‘One Nation, One Election’ Bill.
“The BJP MPs are trying to deflect from the real issue,” stated Rahul Gandhi.

This session highlights ongoing tensions between opposition and ruling party members over procedural disputes and legislative changes.

item.title: 'Gundagardi karte ho?' What happened when Rahul Gandhi approached injured BJP MP Sarangi; watch video - The Times of India
item.description:
'Gundagardi karte ho?' What happened when Rahul Gandhi approached injured BJP MP Sarangi; watch video

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

This article discusses an incident involving Rahul Gandhi as he confronts injured BJP MP Sarangi. The exchange highlights political tensions and reactions.

  • Rahul Gandhi approached BJP MP Sarangi, who was reportedly injured.
  • The encounter was caught on video, highlighting the heated political atmosphere.
  • Gandhi's remarks included the phrase 'Gundagardi karte ho?', translating to 'Do you engage in hooliganism?'
  • The incident has sparked discussions on political decorum and rivalry.
'Gundagardi karte ho?' - Rahul Gandhi during the confrontation.

This incident sheds light on the ongoing hostilities in Indian politics and may further fuel discussions on political behavior.

item.title: Ambedkar row: Parliament in chaos as Rahul's alleged push sends BJP MPs to ICU; Kharge says I was pushed too - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Erupts in Chaos Over Rahul Gandhi's Alleged Push, BJP MPs Injured

Published on: No date provided Source: Hindustan Times

The ongoing political crisis in Indian Parliament escalated dramatically as Congress MP Rahul Gandhi allegedly pushed BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi, resulting in significant injuries and drawing widespread media attention.

  • Rahul Gandhi and other opposition MPs protested on the Makar Dwar, demanding an apology from Home Minister Amit Shah for controversial remarks about BR Ambedkar.
  • Two BJP MPs were hospitalized in ICU following the alleged incident, raising questions about parliamentary decorum.
  • Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge claimed he was also pushed during the melee.
  • Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar have sparked outrage, leading to intensified protests from the opposition.
“Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on me after which I fell down...” - BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi

The incident has opened a broader debate about the safety and decorum within the parliament, and further escalated tensions between ruling and opposition parties.

item.title: Supreme Court Stays Kerala HC's Directions On Use Of Elephants For Temple Festivals Which Are Contrary To ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Stays Kerala HC's Directions On Use Of Elephants For Temple Festivals

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has effectively stayed the restrictions imposed by the Kerala High Court regarding the use of elephants in temple festivals, deeming the High Court's directions as impractical.

  • The Supreme Court ordered that any directions contrary to the Kerala Captive Elephants (Management and Maintenance) Rules, 2012, would remain stayed.
  • The ruling was made in an appeal from the Thiruvambady and Paramekkavu devaswoms.
  • The High Court's directions included specific distances elephants must maintain from the public and each other during festivals.
  • The Supreme Court criticized the High Court for overstepping its authority in regulating temple festivals.
Justice BV Nagarathna remarked that the High Court's directions were 'impractical'.

This decision allows for the continuation of traditional temple festivals in Kerala without the constraints imposed by the High Court.

item.title: Vijay Mallya claims has paid double his debt, now ‘entitled to relief’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vijay Mallya Claims to Have Paid Double His Debt, Now Seeks Relief

Date: Dec 19, 2024
Source: HT News Desk

Vijay Mallya, a fugitive businessman, claims that he has paid off more than double the amount owed on his Kingfisher Airlines debt. He asserts that banks have recovered over ₹14,131 crore from him, while the Debt Recovery Tribunal stated the debt was ₹6,203 crore.

  • Mallya claims bank recoveries exceed twice the debt he was adjudged to owe.
  • He argues that he is entitled to relief unless excess recovery is legally justified.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman confirmed the recovery of properties worth ₹14,131 crore belonging to Mallya.
  • Mallya asserts his innocence, claiming he neither borrowed unlawfully nor stole funds.
  • He has been seeking extradition to India but faces ongoing resistance.
"Unless the ED and Banks can legally justify how they have taken more than two times the debt, I am entitled to relief which I will pursue," Mallya stated.

This controversy highlights ongoing disputes about Mallya's financial dealings and the broader implications for financial accountability in India.

item.title: China harks back to violated 2005 agreement—adjustments, populated areas to delinking border issue from bilateral ties - ThePrint
item.description:
China Revisits 2005 Agreement Amid Border Talks with India

Date: New Delhi | Source: ThePrint

Following the 23rd India-China Special Representatives’ talks, Beijing emphasizes a six-point consensus aimed at resolving the border issue, referencing a 2005 agreement.

  • The talks involved National Security Adviser Ajit Doval and Foreign Minister Wang Yi.
  • The 2005 agreement discusses delinking border issues from overall bilateral relations.
  • China has faced criticism for allegedly violating the agreement since its inception.
  • India insists that relations cannot improve until the status quo from 2020 is restored, which includes the withdrawal of Chinese troops.
“The two sides will resolve the boundary question through peaceful and friendly consultations.”

In conclusion, tensions along the border remain a significant obstacle to improving relations between India and China, with emphasis on past agreements that have not been respected.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 19 Highlights: Priyanka Gandhi, Anurag Thakur in 21-member Joint Parliamentary Committee on ‘One Nation One Election’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 19 Highlights: Priyanka Gandhi, Anurag Thakur in 21-member Joint Parliamentary Committee on ‘One Nation One Election’

Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The government has announced the formation of a Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) to review the ‘One Nation, One Election Bills’. The Congress party has criticized the introduction of the bills and called for their immediate withdrawal.

  • A Joint Parliamentary Committee has been formed for reviewing the ‘One Nation One Election Bills’.
  • Priyanka Gandhi and Manish Tewari represent Congress, while Anurag Thakur and Bansuri Swaraj represent BJP.
  • The Lok Sabha Speaker's decision to vote on the bill led to its approval.
  • Home Minister Amit Shah responded to allegations of disrespect towards Dr. B R Ambedkar during his speech.
  • The debate on the Constitution concluded in Rajya Sabha with Amit Shah’s remarks against the Congress party.

“Ye fashion hogaya hai, Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar… Itna naam agar bhagwan ka lete toh saat janmo tak swarg mil jata.” - Amit Shah

The session was marked by heated debates and significant political exchanges, highlighting ongoing tensions within the Parliament.

item.title: Chennai School Holiday Tomorrow? Heavy Rainfall Expected in KTCC Region, Yellow Alert Issued - Times Now
item.description:
Chennai School Holiday Tomorrow? Heavy Rainfall Expected in KTCC Region, Yellow Alert Issued

Date: December 19, 2023 | Source: Times Now

The Regional Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for heavy rainfall in the KTCC region, affecting Kanchipuram, Tiruvallur, Chennai, and Chengelpattu. Schools are expected to remain closed due to weather conditions.

  • Heavy rainfall expected in KTCC region on December 19.
  • No official announcement yet regarding school closures in Tamil Nadu districts.
  • Moderate rainfall forecasted in neighboring areas, including Villupuram and Puducherry.
  • Weather agency predicts light to moderate rain with thunderstorms across Tamil Nadu.
  • Authorities likely to consider student welfare in deciding on school closures.
“Heavy to very heavy rain is likely to occur at isolated places over Chennai, Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu and Kanchipuram districts.”

The probability of school closures is high due to the severe weather conditions, with authorities prioritizing student safety.

item.title: BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi Of Pushing Its MP In Parliament Complex Chaos, Considers Police Complaint - News18
item.description:
BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi Of Pushing Its MP In Parliament Complex Chaos

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: News18

In a recent altercation in Parliament, BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on him, causing minor injuries. The BJP is considering filing a police complaint regarding the incident.

  • The altercation occurred amid a standoff between Congress and BJP over the Ambedkar row.
  • Several BJP MPs confronted Rahul Gandhi regarding the incident, leading to heated exchanges.
  • Pratap Chandra Sarangi was treated for injuries at RML Hospital.
  • The incident has raised questions about parliamentary conduct and privilege.

“Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on me after which I fell down...” - Pratap Chandra Sarangi

Following the event, serious implications for parliamentary privileges may arise if allegations against Gandhi are proven.

item.title: CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: When is result releasing at iimcat.ac.in? - The Indian Express
item.description:
CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: When is IIMCAT 2024 score card releasing at iimcat.ac.in?

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has now released the final answer keys for the CAT 2024, with results anticipated to be announced shortly. Candidates can access their scorecards on the official website using their registration credentials.

  • 3.29 lakh candidates registered for the CAT exam.
  • Approximately 2.93 lakh candidates appeared for the exam with an attendance rate of 89%.
  • The exam had a total of 1.07 lakh female candidates, 1.86 lakh male candidates, and 5 transgender candidates.
  • Experts believe the CAT 2024 exam was easier than the previous two years, leading to expectations of a higher cut-off.
  • Normalisation processes will be used to determine results, considering various statistical factors.
Candidates with a valid CAT 2024 score will be allowed to register for admission to postgraduate programmes at IIMs and other participating colleges.

This year's CAT results are highly anticipated, and candidates are advised to stay updated on the official site.

item.title: 'Gone mad, should resign': Lalu Yadav takes jibe on Amit Shah over remarks on Ambedkar - The Times of India
item.description:
Lalu Yadav Criticizes Amit Shah's Comments on Ambedkar

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Lalu Yadav has taken a jibe at Amit Shah, criticizing his recent remarks regarding Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, the architect of the Indian Constitution.

  • Lalu Yadav suggests Amit Shah should resign following his comments.
  • The remarks have sparked controversy among political circles.
  • This incident highlights ongoing political tensions surrounding historical figures in India.
“Gone mad, should resign” – Lalu Yadav on Amit Shah's remarks.

The exchange illustrates the heated political atmosphere as leaders engage in public discourse over significant historical personalities.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 20 LIVE: Rahul Gandhi to protest against BR Ambedkar remark by Amit Shah - The Hindu
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session LIVE Day 20: Both Houses adjourned amid Opposition protests over Ambedkar remarks

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The winter session of Parliament faced chaos as both Houses were adjourned shortly after assembly due to protests from opposition parties over Union Home Minister Amit Shah's controversial remarks regarding B.R. Ambedkar.

  • Both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha were adjourned until 2 p.m.
  • Opposition MPs demanded Amit Shah's apology and resignation.
  • Protests continued as the Houses struggled to conduct normal business.
  • Reports indicate heightened tensions between the government and opposition parties over the remarks.
“BJP MPs pushed, prevented me from entering parliament,” said Rahul Gandhi during the protests.

This ongoing turmoil reflects a serious rift in parliamentary proceedings, as opposition parties rally against comments they perceive as an insult to a revered national figure.

item.title: Blocked 18 OTT platforms for publishing obscene, vulgar content: Govt - The Hindu
item.description:
Government Blocks 18 OTT Platforms for Obscene Content

Published on: December 19, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The government has taken action against 18 Over-the-Top (OTT) platforms for publishing obscene and vulgar content, according to Minister L. Murugan in the Lok Sabha.

  • The blocking occurred on March 14, 2024, under the IT Rules of 2021.
  • Intermediaries have specific duties to prevent the display of obscene or pornographic content.
  • There is a Code of Ethics for digital media publishers, requiring adherence to 'Norms of Journalistic Conduct.'
  • The central government has the authority to block content for various national interest reasons.
“The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has taken action in coordination with various intermediaries, and blocked 18 OTT platforms...”

This decision aims to regulate the content available on digital platforms and maintain public order.

item.title: 'We both have been wronged': Vijay Mallya responds to Lalit Modi's birthday wish - The Times of India
item.description:
Vijay Mallya Responds to Lalit Modi's Birthday Wish

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

In a response to Lalit Modi's birthday wishes, Vijay Mallya expressed feelings of being wronged.

  • Mallya comments on the birthday wish from Modi.
  • He articulates his feelings of being wronged.
“We both have been wronged.”

The exchange highlights the complex relationship between the two figures, both of whom have faced significant controversies in their careers.

item.title: GRP on a search for man who boarded ladies coach without clothes - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GRP Searches for Man Who Entered Ladies' Coach Naked

Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Government Railway Police (GRP) are on the hunt for a man who boarded a ladies' compartment of a local train in Mumbai without any clothing. This incident caught public attention after a video went viral on social media.

  • The incident occurred on a Kalyan-bound AC local train.
  • CCTV footage captured the man appearing in a shirt and shorts before he disrobed.
  • Passengers reported his behavior leading to his removal from the train at Vikhroli station.
  • The police have filed an FIR under relevant sections of Indian law.
“An FIR was registered under sections 296 and 162 of the Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita and Indian Railways Act.”

The police continue their search for the unidentified man as this bizarre incident raises concerns about safety in public transport.

item.title: 5 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Kulgam - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Five Terrorists Killed in Kulgam Encounter with Security Forces

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The encounter in Kulgam district resulted in the death of five terrorists following a security operation. Two personnel were injured during the incident.

  • The gunfight began during a cordon and search operation in the Behibagh area.
  • The terrorists opened fire on security forces, leading to a retaliatory strike.
  • The operation was conducted by the Indian Army and Jammu Kashmir Police based on intelligence of terrorist presence.
“On 19 December 24, based on specific intelligence input regarding presence of terrorists, a Joint Operation launched by Indian Army & Jammu Kashmir Police at Kader, Kulgam. Suspicious activity was observed by vigilant troops and on being challenged, terrorists opened indiscriminate and heavy volume of fire. Own troops effectively retaliated.” - Chinar Corps

The encounter highlights ongoing tensions in Jammu and Kashmir, amidst a series of security operations against terrorist activities.

item.title: Amit Shah's remarks show old mentality of BJP, says B.R. Ambedkar's grandson - The Hindu
item.description:
Prakash Ambedkar Critiques Amit Shah's Remarks as Reflective of BJP's Old Mentality

Published on: December 19, 2024

Source: The Hindu

On December 19, 2024, Prakash Ambedkar, grandson of B.R. Ambedkar, asserted that Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments regarding the father of the Constitution showed the BJP's outdated mindset. His remarks prompted protests from the INDIA bloc in Parliament.

  • Ambedkar accused Shah of disrespecting B.R. Ambedkar.
  • He emphasized that the BJP's previous incarnations had opposed Ambedkar during the Constitution's adoption.
  • Congress members also called for Shah to apologize publicly.
  • Ambedkar demanded compensation for the family of Somnath Suryawanshi who died in judicial custody during related protests.
  • He warned that the passage of new election bills could threaten the future of political parties.
"HM @AmitShah, in case you didn't know - Babasaheb Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar is equivalent to God and the Constitution he drafted is a Holy Book for crores of people across the world. How dare you speak about Dr. Ambedkar with such disdain?" — K C Venugopal

Ambedkar's statements reflect ongoing tensions regarding the political portrayal of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar in contemporary discourse.

item.title: J&K: 'Mystery' illness grips Rajouri village, toll at 8 as govt calls in experts - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mystery Illness Claims 8 Lives in Rajouri Village, J&K Government Calls in Experts

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A mysterious illness has struck Badhaal village in Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in eight fatalities, mostly children. Authorities have deployed a central team of experts and a mobile laboratory to investigate the cause of the illness.

  • The death toll has risen to eight, with victims primarily from two families in Badhaal village.
  • A mobile laboratory (BSL-3) has been sent to expedite testing of the illness.
  • The latest victim was a 12-year-old boy who succumbed after being hospitalized for six days.
  • Past cases include the deaths of two of his younger siblings.
"In response to the incident, a Biosafety Level 3 (BSL-3) mobile laboratory has been sent to Rajouri," said a government spokesperson.

This incident highlights the urgency of identifying the illness to prevent further cases, ensuring community safety and health.
